intro: Galium aparine subsp. aparinella, commonly known as common bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that are often covered in fine, hooked hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy surface. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
